intro: Allantodia heterocarpa, commonly known as the African star-of-Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Amaryllidaceae family, which includes other well-known ornamental plants. The plant produces showy, star-shaped flowers that are typically white or pale pink, blooming in late summer to early autumn. Its bulbs are adapted for storage, allowing it to survive dry periods. The leaves are strap-like and evergreen, providing a dense foliage that persists throughout the year.
